#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
#include <algorithm>
#include <cstdlib>
using namespace std;
typedef long long ll;
typedef vector<ll> vll;
ll area(ll x1,ll x2,ll y1,ll y2)
{
	return (x2-x1)*(y2-y1);
}
int main()
{
	ll t,temp,bx,by,tx,ty,ai,at;
	vll x,y;
	scanf("%lld",&t);
	while(t--)
	{
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		x.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		y.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		x.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		y.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		x.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		y.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		x.push_back(temp);
		scanf("%lld",&temp);
		y.push_back(temp);
			//there should be a clarity in ur code.Too many if conditions make it hard to debug.
		//always try to minimize the if conditions.
		bx=max(x[0],x[2]);
		by=max(y[0],y[2]);
		tx=min(x[1],x[3]);
		ty=min(y[1],y[3]);
		ai=area(bx,tx,by,ty);
		at=area(x[0],x[1],y[0],y[1]) + area(x[2],x[3],y[2],y[3]);
		if(bx<tx && by<ty)//if the rectangles are intersecting.
		{
			printf("%lld\n",at-ai);
		}
		else
			printf("%lld\n",at);
		x.clear();
		y.clear();
	}
	return 0;
}
